content: It will spend more this year on content than any film studio or television company does ![How Netflix became a billion-dollar titan](https://cdn.static-economist.com/sites/default/files/20180707_WOC746.png) WHEN Ted Sarandos joined Netflix in 2000, it was just a DVD-rental firm. In 2011, when Netflix was first moving into streaming video, he bought “House of Cards”, a television drama starring Kevin Spacey and Robin Wright and produced by, among others, the film director David Fincher, for $100m. The nine-figure statement of intent was widely derided as profligate, showing that Netflix might be a source of cash but scarcely offered serious competition. A mail-order video store could hardly be expected to take on networks and studios that took decades to build and were notoriously difficult to run. Instead, Netflix has become an industry in and of itself. Mr Sarandos, the company’s chief content officer, and his colleagues will spend $12bn-13bn this year—more than any studio spends on films, or any television company lays out on stuff that isn’t sport. Their viewers will get 82 feature films in a year when Warner Brothers, the Hollywood studio with the biggest slate, will send cinemas only 23. (Disney, the most profitable studio, is putting out just ten.) Netflix is producing or procuring 700 new or exclusively licensed television shows, including more than 100 scripted dramas and comedies, dozens of documentaries and children’s shows, stand-up comedy specials and unscripted reality and talk shows. And its ambitions go far beyond Hollywood. It is currently making programmes in 21 countries, including Brazil, Germany, India and South Korea. Read more in our

eg2: An Activity diagram must be owned by an Activity and must fully and exclusively depict the semantics of that Activity.
一个活动图必须被一个活动所拥有，并且必须全面的和专有的描述该活动的语义学；
A State Machine diagram must be owned by a State Machine and must fully and exclusively depict the semantics of that State Machine.
一个状态机图必须为一个状态机所拥有，并且必须全面的和专有的描述该状态机的语义学。
When we speak, that is - -entirely and  and without any other motive- for communication, except for one thing that the Russian formalists in particular took note of.
当我们开口说话,那是完全地专门地为了交流-,没有任何其它动机，除了一件事,也就是俄国形式主义者特别注意的。

ex: adv. 众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地

wp.notoriously adv: 尤指因坏事;声名狼藉地
wp.Notoriously Abusive Iranian Prosecutor: 众所周知辱骂伊朗检察官

eg2: Could some of the deaths have been prevented in this notoriously high-risk area?
在这个众所周知的高危地区，有些死亡是否可以避免？
Derrida famously, , said "there is nothing outside the text," right? What he meant by that, of course, is that there's nothing but text.
德里达著名地，恶名昭彰地，说道，文本之外什么都没有“,是吧，当然，他意思就是说，需要考虑的只有文本。
Dengue, for example, has  emerged as one of the fastest growing disease burdens in the world; today, cases are reported in many regions formerly free of the disease.
比如，众所周知的登革热已经成为世界上疾病负担增长最快的病种之一，现在，以往没有这一疾病的许多地区出现了病例报告。

ex: v. 取得；诱使（妇女）卖淫

他们为我们弄到了一份报告。
They procured us a copy of the report.
他们给我们弄到了一份报告。

他被控唆使未成年女性卖淫。

Because depending on the meaning of "quickly," it could actually be very .
因为取决于“快速地”的意思，它可能实际上非常有利可图。

eg2: The cost to insure French debt soared this week as traders started to shift their attention away from the economic health of Europe's more  periphery to that of its core members.
上周，随着交易员们开始将他们的经济视角从欧洲那些恣意挥霍的边缘经济体转到了欧洲核心经济体身上，法国债券的保险成本出现了大幅攀升。

只有一个行业会从中获利，那就是：汽车租赁行业。
If your tenant signs a lease with an option to buy, the option payments are generally rental income.
如果你的承租人签订了一个租赁购买合同，分期付款一般来说是租金收入。
In the early 2000s, an architect and his wife converted it from  apartments to a single family home.

ex: adv. 几乎不，简直不；简直没有

If we would not do it, we could scarcely call ourselves libertarians, and most of us would only do it if primarily guided by a passion for justice.
如果我们不会，我们就几乎很难称自己为自由意志主义者，而且我们中的大部分人只会在正义激情的指引下这样做。
